relation: Registry settings for default apps and services
Usability: activate previous instances of unique apps
Windows mesage boxes take ages to come up
make maildir standard work with Windows filesystems
Integration: Setting KMail as default e-mail client, KOrganizer as defaule windows calendaring app, etc. See the notes.
Integration: D&D files onto the message composer
Integration: avoid crashes and conflicts of kwinstartmenu KDED plugin with Start Menu entries added by hand in 3rd-party installers
Unique KDE applications lock DBUS daemon on crash

When another instance of unique appliaction is started, activate previous instance. This is what users expect. Moreover, if standalone application is running, e.g. KMail, and user clicked on "e-mail" component of Kontact, window of the standalone application is activated. (827268)
Native "Open With" dialog should be displayed on Windows by default. (issue2766)

Some dialogs need a lot of time to pop up completly the first time. (issue2708, issue2695); removed the delay by disabling KNotify use in message boxes (not very much used feature currently on Windows anyway).
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {28600=Cyrus SASL functionality is based on plugins. For KDEpimlibs we have set the paths for plugins and configuration to KDEROOT/lib/sasl2/ and KDEROOT/share/config/sasl2/, respectively. The configuration capatibilities are apparently not used for now. (jstaniek February 3 2008), 32718=Reported as http://intevation.de/roundup/kolab/issue2639, 30071=Download SASL library and plugins for mingw and msvc. The archive provides directory structure, so you'll know where to unpack these files.}
textBeforeTable: The Checklist Problem points Temporary fix for Bug 160881: PGP encryption of mails results in empty MIME-part in kdepim can be enabled if you add -DKLEO_SYNCHRONOUS_API_HOTFIX:BOOL=ON to your cmake call. Notes: finally, enter emerge kdepim enter emerge libassuan - this is an optional dependency of kdepim from the cmd.exe command line, enter emerge kdepimlibs - that will also build qt, kdesupport (part of it), soprano, strigi, kdelibs, kdebase unpack gpgme-1.1.4-3-lib.zip and gpgme-1.1.4-3-bin.zip from http://www.winkde.org/pub/kde/ports/win32/repository/win32libs/ to your KDEDIR either build SASL by hand or download precompiled version for mingw and msvc, and install it (if you skip this step you will not have SSL/TLS support in your apps) install emerge and its dependencies as described here Build base KDE libraries for Windows with required dependencies, preferable using emerge tool (because it tracks dependencies for you): Building 5 External Links 4 Links 3 Notes 2.8 Other TODOs 2.7.3.1 Alternative solution 2.7.3 "Locked" dbus-daemon 2.7.2 Crashes in KDED 2.7.1 Crashes in
textAfterTable: Maildir implementation in KMail The implementation based strictly on the original maildir specification in kmail does not work on Windows' file system, since it uses the ":" (forbidden on windows) character in file names. It also relies (as does maildir in general) on the atomicity of making a hardlink and then unlinking the original, to implement an atomic move. The implementation used by akonadi (kdepim/maildir) relies on QFile in that regard, but it's unclear if rename is atomic on all platforms. jstaniek 12:50, 7 January 2008 (CET): Hard/soft links could be handled on Windows by altering the source code so that the "link" file is a text file itself and contains the target path. If we need atomic renames, Windows apparently lacks them, I have found a pre-Vista blog which contains description on how to perform them in a messy but honest way (look at the very last "Write process (on Foo.txt)" version). There's also a way to recover from application/system crash during the pseudo-atomic operations (see the very last "Recovery from a crash during write" checklist). jstaniek 12:42, 24 January 2008 (CET): We will most probably benefit from maildir suport on Windows as Thunderbird (ver. <3) apparently lacks support for this storage, despite many wishes and plans. jstaniek 12:42, 24 January 2008 (CET): regarding replacing ":" character on windows:
